meanings.sent1: The presumptive winner of the race was the fastest runner.
meanings.sent2: It is presumptive that the sun will rise tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: The presumptive chef accidentally added salt instead of sugar to the cake.
meanings.sent4: Her presumptive decision to invest in the stock market paid off handsomely.
meanings.sent5: The presumptive storm clouds gathered ominously in the sky.

meanings.definition: Giving grounds for reasonable opinion or belief
meanings.sent1: The presumptive evidence pointed towards his guilt.
meanings.sent2: Her presumptive actions showed great courage.
meanings.sent3: The presumptive detective mistakenly followed the wrong suspect.
meanings.sent4: His presumptive speech inspired the audience to take action.
meanings.sent5: The presumptive answer seemed logical and well thought out.

meanings.definition: Presumed to be true without proof
meanings.sent1: The presumptive heir to the throne was well-prepared for the responsibility.
meanings.sent2: It was presumptive of him to assume he would always be successful.
meanings.sent3: The presumptive ghost in the story turned out to be a mischievous cat.
meanings.sent4: Her presumptive claim to the title was met with skepticism.
meanings.sent5: The presumptive conclusion was reached after careful consideration.
